wikipedia_page.main: Sir Peter Alexander Clutterbuck  (27 March 1897 – 29 December 1975) was a British diplomat who was high commissioner to Canada and India and ambassador to Ireland.

response: * Sir Alexander Clutterbuck (1897–1975), British diplomat, high commissioner to Canada and India and ambassador to Ireland

response: *1952–1955: Sir Alexander ClutterbuckCLUTTERBUCK, Sir (Peter) Alexander, Who Was Who, A & C Black, 1920–2008; online edn, Oxford University Press, Dec 2012
* Sir (Peter) Alexander Clutterbuck, KCMG, MC, High Commissioner in Canada for Her Majesty's Government in the United Kingdom.
His son was Sir Alexander Clutterbuck, a British diplomat who was high commissioner to Canada and India and ambassador to Ireland.
*Peter Alexander Clutterbuck, Esq., M.C., Acting Assistant Under Secretary of State, Dominions Office.

response: As an artist, Wilson's first exhibitions were held in Grafton Street during the 50s. These exhibitions were opened by Sir Alexander Clutterbuck and Sir Ian Maclennan, both British Ambassadors to Ireland, respectively. Later exhibitions took place in Paris.The Evening Herald, 8 February 1956The Irish Independent, 8 February 1956The Evening Mail, 8 February 1956
